timeline.message: added utility function for token manipulation
added comments and modify the editTokenSignature method.

timeline.bodyText: nit: small case for 1st letter for SharedPrefName.
timeline.author: saugup-ms

replies.bodyText: I have changed the letter in next commit.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText: Do you want to add a check if '.' is not found and 3 segments are not there? Put Assert there
timeline.author: saugup-ms

replies.bodyText: added AssertionError exception whenever string is not segmented into 3 parts by period. ".".
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText: Is there any reason of randomization to 26? It can be any character other than 'a' to 'z'
timeline.author: saugup-ms

replies.bodyText: anything in base64, right?
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: yes, character could vary beyond the "a to z" range however our purpose here is to just invalidate the signature and that could be done by changing any one character.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText: Can we avoid this loop? You can change the character at that index directly.
timeline.author: saugup-ms

replies.bodyText: It has been resolved in next commit. loop has been avoided by adding the next random position in the exiting character.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText:
Looks to be the same as this: https://github.com/AzureAD/microsoft-authentication-library-common-for-android/blob/dev/testutils/src/main/java/com/microsoft/identity/internal/testutils/TestUtils.java#L56
Is there a need to duplicate it?
timeline.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: Methods are private in TestUtils.java file and this file never used therefore I do not understand the purpose this file.
replies.author: jaiswalh

replies.bodyText:
It is indeed used. It is currently being used in tests in MSAL and Broker. See this MSAL Test for instance: https://github.com/AzureAD/microsoft-authentication-library-for-android/blob/dev/msal/src/test/java/com/microsoft/identity/client/e2e/tests/network/AcquireTokenNetworkTest.java#L167
Also you can make them public if you want.
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: Changes has been made accordingly.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText:
Looks to be the same as this: https://github.com/AzureAD/microsoft-authentication-library-common-for-android/blob/dev/testutils/src/main/java/com/microsoft/identity/internal/testutils/TestUtils.java#L52
Is there a need to duplicate it?
timeline.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: Removed duplicate method.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.message: using existing methods in TestUtils to avoid duplication of method.

timeline.bodyText: A head-of-class javadoc section would be nice-to-have here.
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: Added javadoc section in the next commit.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText: public members should have documentation.
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: Added documentation for the method in the next commit.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText: this should probably be public, with appropriate documentation, so that people can implement it.
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: changed the access type to public so it can be implemented and added documentation for the method in the next commit.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText: nit: maybe randomizeCharacterInTokenSignature
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: change the method name.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText: for public method use PascalCasing
timeline.author: dabbcomputers

replies.bodyText:
In java, methods should be verbs, in mixed case with the first letter lowercase, with the first letter of each internal word capitalized.
is there any reason for using PascalCasing ?
replies.author: jaiswalh

replies.bodyText: Please use android java style for java, and C# style for C#.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

timeline.bodyText: is it sure that cacheValue will be instance of string? what if it is not? Should we log or fail?
timeline.author: dabbcomputers

replies.bodyText: cache value is string when stored in the shared preference therefore we would get string whenever we fetch cache value form the cache.
replies.author: jaiswalh

replies.bodyText: why we are checking it then?
replies.author: dabbcomputers

replies.bodyText:
sharedPeference getall() method returns a Map<String, ?> containing list of key/value pairs representing the preference.
"?" which represent any object therefore the Map maps string key to any possible object value. Here our object is of string because both key/value are string when stored in the shared preference. Moreover check has been added to ensure only tokens(value are of string object) should be fetched.
replies.author: jaiswalh

replies.bodyText: We should probably just let it throw a ClassCastException rather than trying to be clever.  This is a test utility.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: Make sense. cast cacheValue to string.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText: same PascalCasing for public ones at all places.
timeline.author: dabbcomputers

replies.bodyText:
n java, methods should be verbs, in mixed case with the first letter lowercase, with the first letter of each internal word capitalized.
is there any reason for using PascalCasing ?
replies.author: jaiswalh

replies.bodyText: Don't use pascal casing.  That's not the correct idiom for java.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

timeline.bodyText: avoid using short forms
timeline.author: dabbcomputers

replies.bodyText: updated the variable name.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText: significant name here
timeline.author: dabbcomputers

replies.bodyText: updated the name.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText: this can go outside 'a' to 'z' range
timeline.author: dabbcomputers

replies.bodyText:
the purpose is to introduce any junk character in place of existing character so to invalidate.
I have updated the logic to get character from base64 characters only and do not go out of bound.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.bodyText: we know that there will be 2 segment then its better to use index to avoid confusion.
timeline.author: dabbcomputers

replies.bodyText: I have made a mistake here, there would be 3 segments and index 0,1,2 were segments of header, payload and signature respectively. I have updated and used index to avoid confusion.
replies.author: jaiswalh

timeline.message: Added java documentation for the public methods and updated logic of randomizeCharacterInTokenSignature method.

timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx

+package com.microsoft.identity.internal.testutils;
+
+import android.content.SharedPreferences;
+import android.text.TextUtils;
+
+import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
+import androidx.arch.core.util.Function;
+
+import com.microsoft.identity.common.internal.cache.CacheKeyValueDelegate;
+import com.microsoft.identity.common.internal.dto.Credential;
+
+import java.util.Map;
+import java.util.Random;
+
+
+/**
+ * This class provide utility to modify the tokens stored in the cache by providing predicate and Function
+ * generic interface. This provide caller flexibility to write its own editing functions to modify the tokens
+ * stored in the cache.
+ */
+public class CacheUtils {
+
+    private static final CacheKeyValueDelegate CACHE_KEY_VALUE_DELEGATE = new CacheKeyValueDelegate();
+
+    /**
+     * Functional interface for editing signature of the token.
+     */
+    public static final Function<String, String> TOKEN_SIGNATURE_EDITOR = new Function<String, String>() {
+        @Override
+        public String apply(String s) {
+            return randomizeCharacterInTokenSignature(s);
+        }
+    };
+
+    /**
+     * Generic functional interface to give caller flexibility of code to evaluate on the given
+     * arguments.
+     *
+     * @param <T> input arguments to evaluate.
+     */
+    public interface Predicate<T> {
+        boolean test(T t);
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * This method will edit all the token specified by the predicate using the  editor
+     * in the shared preference.
+     *
+     * @param sharedPrefName Name of the shared preference where token has been stored.
+     * @param predicate      Generic functional interface representing function that returns true
+     *                       or false depending on token type.
+     * @param editor         Functional interface to have any number of token editing method.
+     */
+    public void editAllTokenInCache(@NonNull final String sharedPrefName, Predicate<String> predicate, Function<String, String> editor) {

replies.bodyText: Added final keyword and NonNull
replies.author: jaiswalh

+/**
+ * This class provide utility to modify the tokens stored in the cache by providing predicate and Function
+ * generic interface. This provide caller flexibility to write its own editing functions to modify the tokens

+     * Functional interface for editing signature of the token.
+     */

+        @Override
+        public String apply(String s) {
+            return randomizeCharacterInTokenSignature(s);
+        }
+    };
+

+     * Generic functional interface to give caller flexibility of code to evaluate on the given
